intro: Ludwigiantha brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of streams. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
